title: Loading State UI for new users
custom_preconds:
[BP-11060](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11060 )

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user does not have an acct in MLB 


*iOS - v14.0.1 (local feature flag enabled) - currently intended for default enablement on v14.1.0
custom_steps: WHEN user onboards a new MLB account in Ballpark app (w/ or w/out tickets)
custom_expected:
THEN the user is shown redacted shells of the HomeCards until loading completes

*when data is getting > 5 seconds to load home page content 
Display a toast with User messaging - “We've made a call to the bullpen. Please hang tight while Ballpark loads!”

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user onboards a new MLB account in Ballpark app w/out tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown redacted shells of the HomeCards until loading completes

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN HomePage loading completes
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN HomePage redacts cards are removed and replaced with actual data
![](index.php?/attachments/get/14463983)

(following may be witnessed, if witnessed then it should auto-dismiss when call completes)
*when data is getting > 5 seconds to load home page content 
Display a toast with User messaging - “We've made a call to the bullpen. Please hang tight while Ballpark loads!”

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user onboards a new MLB account in Ballpark app w/ tickets (prior to verifying acct)*


*prior to onboarding a new acct, forward ticket(s) from any acct to an acct that has not yet been created.
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown redacted shells of the HomeCards until SendVerificationEmail view loads

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is presented AND dismisses the SendVerificationEmail view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN HomePage redacts cards are removed and replaced with actual data
![](index.php?/attachments/get/14463984)


(following may be witnessed, if witnessed then it should auto-dismiss when call completes)
*when data is getting > 5 seconds to load home page content 
Display a toast with User messaging - “We've made a call to the bullpen. Please hang tight while Ballpark loads!”

title: Header with Tickets
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user has tickets on the account for an upcoming event

*iOS - v14.0.1 (local feature flag enabled) - currently intended for default enablement on v14.1.0
custom_steps: WHEN user logs in
custom_expected:
THEN the user is shown the Home Tab
AND user is shown the ticketed event layered on top of the Header

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Home tab w/ Ticketed Event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown MLB logo and 'Ballpark' logo centered at the top
AND user is shown an envelope icon at the top left, representing inbox
AND user is shown a speech bubble icon at the top right, representing chatbot 
AND user is shown an image in the background (top) - green field w/ pitching mound
AND user's Ticketed Event Card is layered on top of the header image, but below the inbox/chatbot/ballpark_logo.

title: Header without Tickets
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user does not have tickets on the account for an upcoming event

*iOS - v14.0.1 (local feature flag enabled) - currently intended for default enablement on v14.1.0
custom_steps: WHEN user logs in
custom_expected: THEN the user is shown the Home Tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Home tab w/out Ticketed Event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown MLB logo and 'Ballpark' logo centered at the top
AND user is shown "Welcome, <first name>." below the Ballpark Logo
AND user is shown an envelope icon at the top left, representing inbox
AND user is shown a speech bubble icon at the top right, representing chatbot 
AND user is shown an image in the background (top) - green field w/ pitching mound

AND NO Ticketed Event Card is layered on top of the header image.
AND first context card is shown, layered at the bottom part of the header image.

title: Bottom Navigation Bar
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app


*iOS - v14.0.1 (local feature flag enabled) - currently intended for default enablement on v14.1.0
custom_steps: WHEN user logs in
custom_expected:
THEN the user is shown the Home Tab
AND user is shown the Bottom Navigation Bar

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Home tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bottom navbar is shown with Home icon highlighted (filled-in) 
AND the other navbar icons are shown as deselected (gray)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates away from Home tab to any other Navbar option
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bottom navbar is shown with destination icon highlighted (filled-in, team navbar icon shown in color) 
AND the other navbar icons are shown as deselected (gray)

title: Card Navigation (webview deeplink)
custom_preconds:
[BP-11052](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11052 )

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user has a Home Context Card configured with a webview deeplink**

*iOS - v14.0.1 (local feature flag enabled) - currently intended for default enablement on v14.1.0
**To keep the scope manageable, add special/custom handling for web views ONLY (progress into nav stack).  For all other deep link types don’t change the existing implementation [Deeplink wiki](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/BET/pages/4014080055/Ballpark+Deep+Links )
(example: ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fapps%2Fballpark%2Fgo-ahead-entry )
custom_steps: WHEN user taps on a Home Context Card configured with a webview deeplink
custom_expected:
THEN the user is progressed into Navigation Stack, with a FullSheet cover to the encoded URL passed within the webview deeplink


A. The new home context card will shortcut `ballpark://webview…` resolution with its own implementation. Everywhere else  `ballpark://webview…` deep links will behave as before – as modal sheets.
B. Home context cards will open web views as Navigation Stack progressions (back button)
C. Home context cards will use the black .mlbSurfacePrimary color for the web view’s navigation toolbar
D. Home context cards will default to hiding navigation controls for web views, but will show the navigation controls if the deep link has hideNav=false in the query string
E. Home context card web views will implement data tiers
F. Home context card will open web views if they are configured to use data tier three and the url’s host is not allowed in Remote Config, but the web view request will not contain the data tier three behavior (authorization header) 
G. If the context card does not open a data tier three url because it’s not allowed in Remote Config, an error will be recorded in Datadog

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps on CTA of Home Context Card configured with a webview deeplink

*GAE Enrolled can be used - directs to MLB LearnMore (example: ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fapps%2Fballpark%2Fgo-ahead-entry )
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is progressed into Navigation Stack, with a FullSheet cover to the encoded URL passed within the webview deeplink
AND user is shown 'Back' and 'Refresh' CTAs for the webview
AND user is shown black color for the web view’s navigation toolbar

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps Back/Refresh within the internal webview
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the expected result is presented to the user ('Back' returns user to Home, 'Refresh' icon reloads the page)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps on CTA of Home Context Card configured with a webview deeplink configured w/ 'hideNav=false' in the query string

*example: ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fapps%2Fballpark%2Fgo-ahead-entry&hideNav=false
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is progressed into Navigation Stack, with a FullSheet cover to the encoded URL passed within the webview deeplink
AND user is shown 'Back' and 'Refresh' CTAs for the webview
AND user is shown black color for the web view’s navigation toolbar

AND user is shown nav controls* within the web views 

*controls are presented with '<', '>' for previous and next page, respectively

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user navigates to additional pages within the webview 
AND user taps '<'/'>'  within the internal webview
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the expected result is presented to the user ('<' returns user to prev webview page, '>' returns user to next webview page)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps on CTA of Home Context Card configured with a webview deeplink configured w/ dataTiers 'dataTier=[0,1,2]' in the query string

*example: ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fapps%2Fballpark%2Fgo-ahead-entry&dataTier=0
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is progressed into Navigation Stack, with a FullSheet cover to the encoded URL passed within the webview deeplink
AND user is shown 'Back' and 'Refresh' CTAs for the webview
AND user is shown black color for the web view’s navigation toolbar
AND the Authorization header will be present (if you observe the web view request in a proxy tool) OR can visually witness Single-Sign-On Authentication occur

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps on CTA of Home Context Card configured with a webview deeplink configured w/ dataTiers 'dataTier=3' in the query string w/ URL encoded Supported as Domain (remote config)

*example: ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mlb.com%2Fapps%2Fballpark%2Fgo-ahead-entry&dataTier=3




Supported Domains for DT3 => [RemoteConfig](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config/env/firebase?query=domains )
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the navigation stack will advance to a web view 
AND the Authorization header will be present (if you observe the web view request in a proxy tool) OR can visually witness Single-Sign-On Authentication occur

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps on CTA of Home Context Card configured with a webview deeplink configured w/ dataTiers 'dataTier=3' in the query string w/ URL encoded NOT Supported as Domain (remote config)

*example: ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.example.com&dataTier=3




Supported Domains for DT3 => [RemoteConfig](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config/env/firebase?query=domains )
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the navigation stack will advance to a web view 
AND the Authorization header will NOT be present(if you observe the web view request in a proxy tool) OR can visually witness Single-Sign-On Authentication NOT occur

custom_steps_separated.content: (confirm error in DataDog Session)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND a non user facing error is logged in Datadog

"BallparkWeb - 403: Forbidden Data Tier Access
Error Domain=BallparkWeb Code=403 "Forbidden Data Tier Access" UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Forbidden Data Tier Access}"


the ULR should be shown 'https://www.example.com' within 'Attribute' tab for the Error within RUM Session

title: Onboarding user, NO Location (by Default)
custom_preconds:
[BP-10993](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10993 )

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user does not have an acct in MLB
AND user onboards a new account successfully

*iOS - v14.0.1 (local feature flag enabled) - currently intended for default enablement on v14.1.0
custom_steps: WHEN a fan is on the HomeTab
custom_expected:
THEN user is displayed the system location enablement prompt 
AND user's selection is saved for future sessions

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on the HomeTab after completing onboarding of a new acct
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed the system location prompt

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the system location prompt is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN prompt header text - “Allow Ballpark to use your location” is displayed

AND "Unlock the full Ballpark experience by granting location access. Enjoy quick venue check-ins, detailed maps, and game suggestions tailored to your location." is displayed above the CTAs

AND 'Allow Once', 'Allow While Using App', and 'Don't Allow' ctas are presented to user

title: Upcoming Games - Location Enablement (w/ and w/out fave team, in/out of range of venue)
custom_preconds:
Location Enablement [BP-10993](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10993 ) / [BPS-3034](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPS-3034 )
Event Promotion Card [BP-10992](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10992 ) / [BP-11069](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11069 )
Favorite team [BP-11103](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11103 )


GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND reg season venue has upcoming data (best if all teams -- otherwise may not match the expectation, when in range(60mi) of a venue that does not yet have data)

*iOS - v14.1.0
custom_steps:
WHEN user is displayed a CTA to ‘enable location’ 
AND upon tap gesture, are displayed the iOS system location prompt 
AND upon selection of ‘allow once’ or 'allow when using app” are displayed
custom_expected: THEN the Upcoming Section is shown based upon conditions of the particular user (often closest geolocated team next home game, or fave team)

custom_steps_separated.content:
UseCase1: No Team, within 60 miles of supported venue w/data 

GIVEN user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND user does NOT have a favorite team stored on MLB.com acct
AND user is within 60 miles of active venue (supported and with data present)
AND user is displayed "Don't miss out on the action" w/ Loc Enablement CTA
WHEN user enables loc permission via CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the venue(s) within 60 miles (after user allows loc)

custom_steps_separated.content:
UseCase2: No Team, NOT within 60 miles of supported venue w/data

GIVEN user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND user does NOT have a favorite team stored on MLB.com acct
AND user is NOT within 60 miles of active venue (supported and with data present)
AND user is displayed "Don't miss out on the action" w/ Loc Enablement CTA
WHEN user enables loc permission via CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown NO CARD within Upcoming Section (nor "Don't miss out on the action")

custom_steps_separated.content:
UseCase3: Fave Team, within 60 miles of supported venue w/data 

GIVEN user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND user DOES have a favorite team stored on MLB.com acct
AND user is within 60 miles of active venue (supported and with data present)
AND user is displayed "Don't miss out on the action" w/ Loc Enablement CTA
WHEN user enables loc permission via CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the venue(s) within 60 miles

custom_steps_separated.content:
UseCase4: Fave Team, Not within 60 miles of supported venue w/data 

GIVEN user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND user DOES have a favorite team stored on MLB.com acct
AND user is NOT within 60 miles of active venue (supported and with data present)
AND user is displayed "Don't miss out on the action" w/ Loc Enablement CTA
WHEN user enables loc permission via CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the venue of the Fave Team associated w/ MLB acct

custom_steps_separated.content:
UseCase5(transition): Fave Team, (initially) Not within 60 miles of supported venue w/data, (transition) within 60 miles 

GIVEN user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND user DOES have a favorite team stored on MLB.com acct
AND user is NOT within 60 miles of active venue (supported and with data present)
AND user is displayed "Don't miss out on the action" w/ Loc Enablement CTA
WHEN user enables loc permission via CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the venue of the Fave Team associated w/ MLB acct

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters the 60 mile criteria of an active venue
THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the venue(s) within 60 miles
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the venue(s) within 60 miles

custom_steps_separated.content:
UseCase6: Fave Team, within 60 miles of fave team venue w/data 

GIVEN user does NOT have loc permission enabled for BP app
AND user DOES have a favorite team stored on MLB.com acct
AND user is within 60 miles of favorited/active venue (supported and with data present)
AND user is displayed "Don't miss out on the action" w/ Loc Enablement CTA
WHEN user enables loc permission via CTA
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown the Upcoming Games of the fave teams venue(s) within 60 miles - indicated with the distance to the venue. 
(to confirm that LOC display of Upcoming Games should be shown instead of FAVEteam display of Upcoming Games)

title: Upcoming Games - Location (requires location enabled, statsAPI data)
custom_preconds:
Event Promotion Card [BP-10992](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10992 ) / [BP-11069](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11069 )


GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user satisfies criteria to show upcoming sections [see case](https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/34569713 )

*iOS - v14.0.1 (local feature flag enabled) - currently intended for default enablement on v14.1.0
custom_steps:
WHEN device is within 60 miles of the stadiums location **
AND the user is on the Home tab

** location mock tools make it easy to validate all stadiums (including multiple cards, such as NY/LA/CHI)
custom_expected:
THEN Home Tab will display 'Upcoming Games' section with relevant matchup cards, providing a personalized experience
(multiple match-up cards shown, when appropriate)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN device is configured to each stadium **
AND the user is on the Home tab

**
*(using Debug Build)> About Ballpark > Developer Tools > Change GPS Location > [TEAM]
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see an upcoming game matchup with a call to action to buy tickets **

Display:
* In section “Upcoming Games”
* Title above matchup card w/ text listing distance from stadium - “LESS THAN 1 MILE AWAY”
* Matchup string (e.g. Away team name vs Home team name)
* Matchup card with Away logo, home logo
* Date and time string (Mon, Apr 26 • 7:00 PM ET)
* Venue name string
* Event description string, if available

**
Note: certain locations will display multiple matchup cards - validation should be performed for each

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user tap's on the call to action to buy tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be taken to a purchase webview for the upsell game **

**
Note: certain locations will display multiple matchup cards - validation should be performed for each

title: Upcoming Games - FavoriteTeam (requires faveteam, statsAPI data)
custom_preconds:
Event Promotion Card [BP-10992](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10992 ) / [BP-11069](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11069 )
FaveTeam [BP-11103](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11103 ) / [BP-11158](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11158 )



GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user satisfies criteria to show upcoming sections [see case](https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/34569713 )
custom_steps:
GIVEN user has fave team(s) associated with the acct **(including data from Stats for the particular team(s))

WHEN user does NOT have loc Enabled
AND the user is on the Home tab

OR 

WHEN user has loc Enabled BUT device is NOT within 60 miles of any stadiums location **
AND the user is on the Home tab

** location mock tools make it easy to validate
custom_expected:
THEN Home Tab will display 'Upcoming Games' section with relevant matchup cards relevant to FaveTeam(s), providing a personalized experience
(multiple match-up cards shown, when appropriate)

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has fave team(s) associated with the acct **

WHEN device has Location disabled 
AND the user is on the Home tab

**(including data from Stats for the particular team(s))
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see an upcoming game matchup with a call to action to buy tickets **

Display:
* In section “Upcoming Games”
* Title above matchup card w/ text listing venue name WITHOUT distance from venue
* Matchup string (e.g. Away team name vs Home team name)
* Matchup card with Away logo, home logo
* Date and time string (Mon, Apr 26 • 7:00 PM ET)
* Venue name string
* Event description string, if available

**
Note: if multiple teams are favorited, Upcoming games will display multiple matchup cards - validation should be performed for each. BPapp only shows first 3 favorited team (if more than 3)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user tap's on the call to action to buy tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be taken to a purchase webview for the upsell game **

**
Note: if more than 1 fave team listed, Home will display multiple matchup cards - validation should be performed for each

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has fave team(s) associated with the acct **
WHEN user has loc Enabled BUT device is NOT within 60 miles of any other venue location ***
AND the user is on the Home tab


**including data from Stats for the particular team(s)
***location mock tools make it easy to validate, (using Debug Build)> About Ballpark > Developer Tools > Change GPS Location > OUTSIDE range of all other venues (i.e Maine or Wyoming)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see an upcoming game matchup with a call to action to buy tickets **

Display:
* In section “Upcoming Games”
* Title above matchup card w/ text listing venue name WITHOUT distance from venue
* Matchup string (e.g. Away team name vs Home team name)
* Matchup card with Away logo, home logo
* Date and time string (Mon, Apr 26 • 7:00 PM ET)
* Venue name string
* Event description string, if available

**
Note: if multiple teams are favorited, Upcoming games will display multiple matchup cards - validation should be performed for each. BPapp only shows first 3 favorited team (if more than 3)

custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be taken to a purchase webview for the upsell game **

**
Note: if more than 1 fave team listed, Home will display multiple matchup cards - validation should be performed for each

title: Next Ticketed Event - EventHub (GameEvents)
custom_preconds:
[BP-10990](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10990 )

custom_steps: WHEN user logs in
custom_expected:

AND user is shown an envelope icon at the top left, representing inbox
AND user is shown a speech bubble icon at the top right, representing chatbot
AND user is shown an image in the background (top) - green field w/ pitching mound
AND user's Ticketed Event Card is layered on top of the header image, but below the inbox/chatbot/ballpark_logo.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Next Ticketed Event (GAME)

Ticket Information - Each ticket clearly shows the following information:
* Matchup: Teams playing (e.g., "Nationals at Royals")
** Start Time: Date and time of the event (e.g., "Sun, May 28 • 1:35 PM CT")
** Venue: Name of the stadium (e.g., "Kauffman Stadium")

Team Identification - Team logos are displayed for both teams in the matchup

AND user taps 'Access Tickets'
custom_steps_separated.expected:

custom_steps_separated.content:

AND user is shown an envelope icon at the top left, representing inbox
AND user is shown a speech bubble icon at the top right, representing chatbot

IF GAME
* Matchup: Teams playing (e.g., "Nationals at Royals")

IF NONGAME

** Start Time: Date and time of the event (e.g., "Sun, May 28 • 1:35 PM CT")

AND user taps 'Verify Account to Access Tickets'

And user is displayed "Send Verification Email" button

custom_steps_separated.expected:

AND user is shown instructions to check email (primary)

custom_steps_separated.expected:

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user triggers "OK from the verification email sent page
WHEN user attempts to trigger another verification email
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is throttled and the "Send Verification Email" button is inactive for 30 seconds following tap of "Send Verification Email"

custom_steps_separated.content: (after awaiting 30 secs)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is able to 'Send Verification Email' again

title: Context Card - Go-AheadPay - Plan Your Next Stadium Visit [CLE Fan, CLE Ticket]
custom_preconds:
[BP-10991](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10991 ) / [BP-11077](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11077 ) / [BP-11107](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11107 ) / [BP-11076](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11076 )
[Home Content Display - Context Cards](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10xB__FHRwQeGhhjW2ZF6MXAbvAuOZPxBobcZOQQH_EI/edit?gid=0#gid=0 )


GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_steps:
WHEN user has fave team set to CLE (teamID=114)
AND user has a ticketed event to Progressive Field (venueID=5)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user navigates to Home tab w/ specified criteria (this could change based on configuration)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown MLB Wallet Context Card 
*Title: "Access your wallet with Go-Ahead Pay"
*Description: "Pay for concessions effortlessly with stored cards & entitlements."
*SideImg: Image of a credit card with Team logo 
*CTA: Arrow


**above is configured w/in CardCreator and is subject to change
AND the section title above the card is "Plan Your Next Stadium Visit"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on the MLB Wallet Context Card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to deeplink that is configured (typically the MLB wallet page specific to the club)

example: ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpwa.use1.venuepaas.com%2FPWA%2FClInti47Bw%2F50%2Finitiate%3Fmodule%3DmyWallet%26provider%3Dappetize%26type%3Dfnb&displayTitle=Go%20Ahead%20Pay&dataTier=3

title: Context Card - Go-AheadPay - Know Before You Go [CLE Ticket, HoursPrior to EventStart]
custom_preconds:
[BP-10991](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10991 ) / [BP-11077](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11077 ) / [BP-11107](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11107 ) / [BP-11076](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11076 )
[Home Content Display - Context Cards](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10xB__FHRwQeGhhjW2ZF6MXAbvAuOZPxBobcZOQQH_EI/edit?gid=0#gid=0 )


GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_steps:
WHEN user has a ticketed event to Progressive Field (venueID=5)
AND user device time is less than HoursPrior to EventStart (currently set to < 12)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user navigates to Home tab w/ specified criteria (this could change based on configuration)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown MLB Wallet Context Card
*Title: "Access your wallet with Go-Ahead Pay"
*Description: "Pay for concessions effortlessly with stored cards & entitlements."
*SideImg: Image of a credit card with Team logo
*CTA: Arrow

**above is configured w/in CardCreator and is subject to change
AND the section title above the card is "Know Before You Go"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on the MLB Wallet SetUp Context Card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to deeplink that is configured (typically the MLB wallet page specific to the club)

example: ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpwa.use1.venuepaas.com%2FPWA%2FClInti47Bw%2F50%2Finitiate%3Fmodule%3DmyWallet%26provider%3Dappetize%26type%3Dfnb&displayTitle=Go%20Ahead%20Pay&dataTier=3

title: Error state - You're Offline (Network OFF)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the network service is unavailable
custom_steps: WHEN user is on the home tab
custom_expected:
Then the app should display a "No Network Connection" message
And show a "You're offline. Turn on data or connect to Wifi to access MLB Ballpark" instruction

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user network connection is currently unavailable **
AND user is on the home tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed a "No Network Connection" message
AND "You're offline. Turn on data or connect to Wifi to access MLB Ballpark" instruction is shown in a toast


"We've made a call to the bullpen. Please hang tight while Ballpark loads!" connectionLost message can be shown, depending on circumstance  [poss IOS only]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN network service is restored
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown updated Home tab
AND Network error message is auto-dismissed

title: Error state - Hang tight while Ballpark Loads (Network ON, HomeService Unavailable)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the home service is unavailable

NOTE: this can also be verified via throttling (via proxy or iOS>Settings>Developer>Network Link Conditioner)

*iOS - v14.0.1 (local feature flag enabled) - currently intended for default enablement on v14.1.0
custom_steps: WHEN user is on the home tab
custom_expected: Then the app should display a "We've made a call to the bullpen. Please hang tight while Ballpark loads" toast message

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user has network connection 
AND the home service is currently unavailable **
AND user is on the home tab



** To simulate Home Service unavailable - use Charles and had breakpoint to request 
* bphometab.mobile.mlbinfra.com - Staging
* bphometab.mobileqa.mlbinfra.com - QA

NOTE: this can also be verified via throttling (via proxy or iOS>Settings>Developer>Network Link Conditioner)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then user is displayed a "We've made a call to the bullpen. Please hang tight while Ballpark loads" toast message


"We've made a call to the bullpen. Please hang tight while Ballpark loads!" connectionLost message can be shown, depending on circumstance  [poss IOS only]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN home service is restored
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown updated Home tab
AND toast message is auto-dismissed

title: Error state - Having Trouble Personalizing (Network ON, HomeService data misconfigured)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the home service has produced a home doc that is misconfigured**


*iOS - v14.0.1 (local feature flag enabled) - currently intended for default enablement on v14.1.0
**NOTE: this can also be verified via locking the test acct's HomeDoc and then updating a String value to Null (i.e 'textColor' for the text of one of the ContextCards)
custom_steps: WHEN user is on the home tab
custom_expected: Then the app should display a "We're having trouble personalizing your Home Tab. Please try again" toast message

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user has network connection 
AND the home service is producing a misconfigured HomeDoc **
AND user is on the home tab



** To simulate Home Service misconfigured - after locking the homedoc, change a value within the specific okta's home tab - 
* https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/firestore/databases/-default-/data/~2Fhometab - PRD
* https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/firestore/databases/-default-/data/~2Fhometab-staging - STG
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then user is displayed a "We're having trouble personalizing your Home Tab. We're working behind the scenes to get this fixed for you." toast message


"We've made a call to the bullpen. Please hang tight while Ballpark loads!" connectionLost message can be shown, depending on circumstance  [poss IOS only]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN home service restores HomeDoc to be correctly configured
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown updated Home tab
AND toast message is auto-dismissed (can be triggered with Retry CTA)

title: Home Modernization : Analytics
custom_preconds:
[BP-11091](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-11091 )
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app*
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app

*iOS - v14.0.1 (local feature flag enabled) - currently intended for default enablement on v14.1.0
custom_expected:
tracking info is posted to https://mlb.sc.omtrdc.net verified via proxy tool (or dev-tools w/in BPapp)
*MLB Ballpark : Home : <page/action/etc>

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user has Tickets shown on Home page w/ Acct verified

[CONFIRM IF HOME NTE CARD(pagename) SHOULD BE TRACKED (not currently) - SEEKING CLARITY]
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The following is tracked: 
* MLB Ballpark : Home (pagename)

(applies for the the action pressed by the user)
* MLB Ballpark : Home : Inbox Click
* MLB Ballpark : Home : Chatbot Click
* MLB Ballpark : Home : Access Tickets Click
* MLB Ballpark : Home : Event Hub Click
* MLB Ballpark : Tab : Home Tab Click

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has context cards shown on Home page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
(applies for the context cards that are actually shown)
* MLB Ballpark : Home : Buy Tickets (pagename)
* MLB Ballpark : Home : Home : Going with friends v2 (pagename)
* MLB Ballpark : Home : MLB Ballpark : Home : Set Your Favorite Team (duplicated?)
* MLB Ballpark : Home : Select your favorite team in Ballpark Click

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has Tickets shown on Home page w/ Acct unverified
custom_steps_separated.expected:
(applies for the context cards that are actually shown)
* MLB Ballpark : Home : Verify Account to Access Tickets Click

custom_steps_separated.content: AND user has triggered the verify CTA on NTE Peeking
custom_steps_separated.expected:
MLB Ballpark : Home : Unverified Sheet
MLB Ballpark : Home : Verified Account : Send Verification Email Click

MLB Ballpark : Home : Verification Email Sent
MLB Ballpark : Home : Verified Account : Send Verification Email : Ok Click

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user has device loc prompt shown on Home page

[SEEING INCONSISTENCIES W/ DEVICE LOC PROMPT - SEEKING CLARITY]
custom_steps_separated.expected: * MLB Ballpark : Enable Location : Modal (pagename)

custom_steps_separated.content: [SEEING INCONSISTENCIES W/ DEVICE LOC PROMPT - SEEKING CLARITY]
custom_steps_separated.expected:
(applies for the the action pressed by the user)
* MLB Ballpark : Enable Location : Modal : When In Use Authorized Click (action)
* MLB Ballpark : Enable Location : Modal : <CONFIRM ALLOW ONCE CTA> Click (action)
* MLB Ballpark : Enable Location : Modal : MLB Ballpark : Enable Location : Modal : Not Determined Click (action)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has Location Enablement prompt shown on Home
custom_steps_separated.expected: * MLB Ballpark : Home : Location Enablement : Re-prompt Click

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has Upcoming Games module shown on Home
custom_steps_separated.expected:
* MLB Ballpark : Home : Upcoming Games
* MLB Ballpark : Home : Upcoming Games Module : Buy Tickets Click

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has network error shown on the Home Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: [SEEING INCONSISTENCIES W/ ERROR PROMPT - SEEKING CLARITY]
